intro: Elaeodendron xylocarpum var. bermudense, commonly known as the Bermuda elaeodendron, is a rare shrub native to Bermuda. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and distinctive yellowish-brown fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the subtropical climate of Bermuda. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
